data.chText: （用以启动某些机器或用作支付方式的）代币，专用辅币
data.enText: a round piece of metal or plastic used instead of money to operate some machines or as a form of payment

data.chText: 停车专用辅币
data.enText: a parking token

data.chText: 代价券
data.enText: a piece of paper that you pay for and that sb can exchange for sth in a shop/store

data.chText: 价值20英镑的书券 / 唱片券 / 礼物券
data.enText: a £20 book/record/gift token

data.chText: 赠券；礼券
data.enText: a piece of paper that you can collect when you buy a particular product and then exchange for sth

data.chText: 收集到六张礼券可以换一件T恤衫。
data.enText: Collect six tokens for a free T-shirt.

data.chText: （感觉、事实、事件等的）象征，标志，表示，信物
data.enText: something that is a symbol of a feeling, a fact, an event, etc.

data.chText: 区区薄礼，以表谢忱，请笑纳。
data.enText: Please accept this small gift as a token of our gratitude.
by the same token

data.chText: 由于同样的原因；同样地
data.enText: for the same reasons

data.chText: 失败就要付出沉重的代价，同样，成功就会获得很大的回报。
data.enText: The penalty for failure will be high. But, by the same token, the rewards for success will be great.

data.chText: 装样子的；装点门面的；敷衍的
data.enText: involving very little effort or feeling and intended only as a way of showing other people that you think sb/sth is important, when really you are not sincere

data.chText: 政府只不过是做做样子表示了一下对失业者的帮助。
data.enText: The government has only made a token gesture towards helping the unemployed.

data.chText: 委员会中有一位装点门面的女性委员。
data.enText: There was one token woman on the committee (= a woman who is included in the group to make it look as if women are always included, although that is not true) .

data.chText: 象征性的；作为标志的
data.enText: done as a symbol to show that you are serious about sth and will keep a promise or an agreement or do more later

data.chText: 政府同意派遣一小支象征性的部队到那一地区。
data.enText: The government agreed to send a small token force to the area.

data.chText: 一天的象征性罢工
data.enText: a one-day token strike

data.chText: 象征性的（付款或费用）

before.enText: of a small amount of money

data.enText: that you pay or charge sb only as a symbol, because a payment is expected

data.chText: 我们对使用这些设施只收取象征性的费用。
data.enText: We charge only a token fee for use of the facilities.

means: (用以启动某些机器或用作支付方式的)专用辅币

data.enText: by the same token

data.chText: 由于同样的原因；同样地
data.enText: for the same reasons

data.chText: 失败就要付出沉重的代价，同样，成功就会获得很大的回报。
data.enText: The penalty for failure will be high. But, by the same token, the rewards for success will be great.

tr: a metal or plastic disk that can be redeemed or used in designated slot machines
something serving as a sign of something else
an individual instance of a type of symbol
example: the word`error' contains three tokens of `r'

value.def: You use token to describe things or actions which are small or unimportant but are meant to show particular intentions or feelings which may not be sincere.

example.ex: The announcement was welcomed as a step in the right direction, but was widely seen as a token gesture...
example.tran: 该公告被认为是向正确方向迈进的一步，因而受到欢迎，但也被普遍看作是一种象征性的姿态。

example.ex: Miners have staged a two-hour token stoppage to demand better pay and conditions…
example.tran: 矿工们举行了两小时的象征性停工，以要求提高工资和改善工作条件。

example.ex: You described her as the token woman on the shortlist.
example.tran: 你把她形容为入围名单上象征性的女性人选。

value.def: A token is a piece of paper or card that can be exchanged for goods, either in a particular shop or as part of a special offer.

example.tran: 价值 10 英镑的购书券

example.ex: Here is the fifth token towards our offer. You need six of these tokens.
example.tran: 这是第 5 张礼券，你需要 6 张才能享受我们的特价。

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 coupon

value.def: A token is a round flat piece of metal or plastic that is sometimes used instead of money.

example.ex: Some of the older telephones still only accept tokens.
example.tran: 一些较老式的电话机仍然只收代币。

value.def: If you give something to a person or do something for them as a token of your feelings, you give it or do it as a way of expressing those feelings.

example.ex: He kept sending gifts and assured her that they were merely small tokens of his appreciation…
example.tran: 他不断送她礼物，并向她保证说这些只是为了略表谢意。

example.ex: As a token of goodwill, I'm going to write another letter.
example.tran: 为了证明我的善意，我打算再写一封信。

example.ex: …the custom of exchanging love tokens to celebrate February 14.
example.tran: 互换爱情信物以庆祝 2 月 14 号情人节的风俗

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.def: You use by the same token to introduce a statement that you think is true for the same reasons that were given for a previous statement.

example.ex: If you give up exercise, your muscles shrink and fat increases. By the same token, if you expend more energy you will lose fat.
example.tran: 停止锻炼会使肌肉萎缩、脂肪增加。同样，如果花更多的精力锻炼，就会减掉脂肪。

value.tran: 同样地;由于同样的原因
